snippet: The choice of impoverished Cambodia as a new home for asylum seekers has so far attracted little interest among the refugees.
abstract: Cambodia agrees to accept three Iranians and one Rohingya man from Myanmar who were turned away by Australia, as part of $32 million agreement between the two countries; human rights advocates denounce plan to resettle hundreds of asylum seekers in impoverished Cambodia, calling it as misguided and inhumane.
lead_paragraph: The choice of impoverished Cambodia as a new home for asylum seekers has so far attracted little interest among the refugees.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
